result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:04 AM Defendant Alexander Scott Cloutier in court.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by video for Alexander Scott Cloutier.  Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Limbeck. Statement by defendant. Defendant wants to fire his attorney. Statement by Court. Court denies motion to withdraw. Court has advised defendant of penalties. Court sets $2,000 signature bond in 22CF34. Bond continued in other cases. adj. 10:16am jjm
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
